reviews.review_msg: I don't usually write these but Dr. Nair is easily one of the best professors I have had at SFU. You are doing yourself a disservice if you dont take BUS 373 with her. She had clear, well-paced lectures with lots of in-class time for examples and working through problems.

I don't think she is suited to teach for this course; she is teaching 373 for the first time. I have taken 232 with her; she is so great and familiar with that one, but this one is not! Very short time to take a quiz with so much work is suck! Choose another prof.

Salar is a nice person but had a hard time explaining many of the basic concepts in operations management.  He spent a lot of time explaining concepts incorrectly and had to be corrected by his students on a handful of occasions.  The final exam related only marginally to the taught material.

Salar is a chill dude. He teaches and explains the concepts in the course very well. There were often awkward silences during the lectures but it's because he is a new prof. I'm sure he's going to be better after a few semesters. He posts all notes from class on canvas so if you miss a class it's easy to catch up. Overall great prof.
Best prof ever I haven taken at SFU Beedie! Never miss this A+ section everyone!

He gave me the first A+ in my BBA life (last term, with a 373)! I heard my friends say he is coming back and going to teach again, just come to write it to my friends! GO GO GO! If you did not choose his sections, you will regret it forever, so PLEASE CHOOSE HIM, Buddy!

Extraordinarily pleasant, he's a model for all Beedie faculty ~ he doesn't teach at SFU often, so if you see his name, don't hesitate to grab it! Quick! You have to be quick, in our classes he gave so many A's and B's above!

I have to compliment this professor! Took BUS336 & BUS373 with him, both were the “Easiest 100%” exams, and you didn't even have to travel to the classroom to learn well. Average didn't affect the ratio of A's - B+'s he gave! Best professor in life, bar none！！！！

He completed his course about a year ago for BUS 373, and the exam was very easy, similar to childhood calculations and super straightforward. It's easy to score full marks, and he gave more A's than other faculty, so please choose him without any doubts.
The assignments are very easy, provide free credits, and help you apply what you've learned in real-world situations. Office hours are extremely helpful — he is always patient and approachable.
I enjoy his teaching style, which offers very helpful instructions. Please work with him! Other 373 instructors are not good to study with, he is the GOAT!
Best instructor I have ever met at SFU, he is the best choice for this course!
I really like her teaching style; she is a smart, young, and caring instructor who really wants her students to succeed and get improved.

Mona is probably one of the best profs in Beedie, especially for a course like 373. She taught exceptionally well and made sure the students understood the material before moving on. Lecture speed is not too slow or fast, and if you know the material, just go on your phone for a bit. Would recommend taking 373 with her when you can.

Honestly, Mona is one of the best professors I have had at SFU. She explains everything so well and is so kind and compassionate to students whenever they need help. She was always clear on expectations and provided a ton of helpful practice problems and detailed solutions. She deserves a more than a 5/5 and I highly recommend her to anyone in BUS.

the classroom is so hot in Room WMC3520 i almost die every lecture. There is a fan sitting next to her that she wont turn on while i'm dying from the heat. Great professor, but the heat is killing me. i legit wear shorts and t shirt in winter lectures and i'm still dying from the heat, its legit like sitting in an oven for 3 hours. Great prof 10/10
I think this course is easy interms of it's structure(no finals), but is useful
